name: Vegetable Biryani
description: A fragrant rice dish made with long-grain basmati rice, mixed vegetables, and a blend of aromatic spices and herbs, cooked to perfection.

name: Paneer Butter Masala
description: Soft cubes of paneer cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based gravy with butter, cream, and a blend of Indian spices, best enjoyed with naan or rice.

name: Aloo Gobi
description: A classic North Indian dish made with potatoes (aloo) and cauliflower (gobi), saut√©ed with onions, tomatoes, and a mix of spices, perfect with roti or paratha.

name: Palak Paneer
description: A nutritious and creamy dish made with fresh spinach (palak) cooked with paneer cubes in a flavorful blend of spices, ideal with steamed rice or chapati.

name: Vegetable Korma
description: A rich and flavorful curry made with a variety of vegetables cooked in a creamy coconut-based sauce with cashews, onions, and spices, served with rice or bread.

name: Masala Dosa
description: A popular South Indian dish made with a thin and crispy crepe-like dosa filled with a spicy potato masala, served with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Chana Masala
description: A delicious and hearty chickpea curry made with onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices, perfect with steamed rice, naan, or poori.

name: Dal Makhani
description: A creamy and flavorful lentil dish made with black lentils (urad dal) and kidney beans (rajma), slow-cooked with butter, cream, and a mix of aromatic spices.

name: Gobi Manchurian
description: Crispy cauliflower florets coated in a spicy and tangy Manchurian sauce made with soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and green chilies, served as a popular Indo-Chinese appetizer.

name: Veg Pulao
description: A fragrant and flavorful rice dish cooked with mixed vegetables, whole spices, and herbs, making it a perfect one-pot meal for lunch or dinner.

name: Idli Sambar
description: Soft and fluffy steamed rice cakes (idli) served with a tangy and flavorful lentil-based vegetable stew (sambar), a staple South Indian breakfast.

name: Uttapam
description: A thick and savory pancake made from fermented rice and lentil batter, topped with onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and coriander leaves, served with coconut chutney.

name: Rava Upma
description: A savory South Indian breakfast dish made with semolina (rava) cooked with onions, mustard seeds, curry leaves, and spices, served hot with coconut chutney.

name: Avial
description: A traditional Kerala dish made with mixed vegetables, coconut, yogurt, and spices, cooked to a thick consistency, and served with steamed rice, a must-have for Onam.

name: Pesarattu
description: A healthy and nutritious dosa made from green gram (moong dal) batter, served with ginger chutney or upma, popular in Andhra Pradesh.

name: Sambhar Vada
description: Crispy and fluffy deep-fried lentil donuts (vada) soaked in tangy and spicy sambar, a classic South Indian snack often enjoyed with coconut chutney.

name: Bisi Bele Bath
description: A flavorful and spicy rice dish cooked with lentils, mixed vegetables, tamarind, and a special spice blend, garnished with ghee-roasted cashews and served hot.

name: Chole Bhature
description: A popular North Indian dish consisting of spicy chickpea curry (chole) served with fluffy deep-fried bread (bhature), often enjoyed as a hearty meal or brunch.

name: Mysore Masala Dosa
description: A variation of masala dosa where the dosa is smeared with a spicy red chutney (Mysore chutney) and filled with a potato masala, a specialty of Karnataka.

name: Rasam
description: A tangy and spicy South Indian soup made with tamarind, tomatoes, lentils, and a blend of spices, often served as a comforting appetizer or part of a meal.

name: Pani Puri
description: A popular street food snack made with crispy hollow puris filled with a spicy and tangy mixture of tamarind water, potatoes, chickpeas, and chaat masala.

name: Dahi Vada
description: Soft and fluffy lentil dumplings soaked in creamy and tangy yogurt, garnished with a mix of sweet and spicy chutneys, a popular North Indian snack.

name: Vada Pav
description: A spicy and flavorful potato fritter (vada) served in a soft bun (pav) with a variety of chutneys, a popular street food snack from Mumbai.
